description: Describes the specified instance types. By default, all instance types for the current Region are described. Alternatively, you can filter the results.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: One or more filters. Filter names and values are case-sensitive. auto-recovery-supported - Indicates whether Amazon CloudWatch action based recovery is supported ( true | false). bare-metal - Indicates whether it is a bare metal instance type ( true | false). burstable-performance-supported - Indicates whether the instance type is a burstable performance T instance type ( true | false). current-generation - Indicates whether this instance type is the latest generation instance type of an instance family ( true | false). dedicated-hosts-supported - Indicates whether the instance type supports Dedicated Hosts. ( true | false) ebs-info.ebs-optimized-info.baseline-bandwidth-in-mbps - The baseline bandwidth performance for an EBS-optimized instance type, in Mbps. ebs-info.ebs-optimized-info.baseline-iops - The baseline input/output storage operations per second for an EBS-optimized instance type. ebs-info.ebs-optimized-info.baseline-throughput-in-mbps - The baseline throughput performance for an EBS-optimized instance type, in MB/s. ebs-info.ebs-optimized-info.maximum-bandwidth-in-mbps - The maximum bandwidth performance for an EBS-optimized instance type, in Mbps. ebs-info.ebs-optimized-info.maximum-iops - The maximum input/output storage operations per second for an EBS-optimized instance type. ebs-info.ebs-optimized-info.maximum-throughput-in-mbps - The maximum throughput performance for an EBS-optimized instance type, in MB/s. ebs-info.ebs-optimized-support - Indicates whether the instance type is EBS-optimized ( supported | unsupported | default). ebs-info.encryption-support - Indicates whether EBS encryption is supported ( supported | unsupported). ebs-info.nvme-support - Indicates whether non-volatile memory express (NVMe) is supported for EBS volumes ( required | supported | unsupported). free-tier-eligible - Indicates whether the instance type is eligible to use in the free tier ( true | false). hibernation-supported - Indicates whether On-Demand hibernation is supported ( true | false). hypervisor - The hypervisor ( nitro | xen). instance-storage-info.disk.count - The number of local disks. instance-storage-info.disk.size-in-gb - The storage size of each instance storage disk, in GB. instance-storage-info.disk.type - The storage technology for the local instance storage disks ( hdd | ssd). instance-storage-info.encryption-support - Indicates whether data is encrypted at rest ( required | supported | unsupported). instance-storage-info.nvme-support - Indicates whether non-volatile memory express (NVMe) is supported for instance store ( required | supported | unsupported). instance-storage-info.total-size-in-gb - The total amount of storage available from all local instance storage, in GB. instance-storage-supported - Indicates whether the instance type has local instance storage ( true | false). instance-type - The instance type (for example c5.2xlarge or c5*). memory-info.size-in-mib - The memory size. network-info.bandwidth-weightings - For instances that support bandwidth weighting to boost performance ( default, vpc-1, ebs-1). network-info.efa-info.maximum-efa-interfaces - The maximum number of Elastic Fabric Adapters (EFAs) per instance. network-info.efa-supported - Indicates whether the instance type supports Elastic Fabric Adapter (EFA) ( true | false). network-info.ena-support - Indicates whether Elastic Network Adapter (ENA) is supported or required ( required | supported | unsupported). network-info.encryption-in-transit-supported - Indicates whether the instance type automatically encrypts in-transit traffic between instances ( true | false). network-info.ipv4-addresses-per-interface - The maximum number of private IPv4 addresses per network interface. network-info.ipv6-addresses-per-interface - The maximum number of private IPv6 addresses per network interface. network-info.ipv6-supported - Indicates whether the instance type supports IPv6 ( true | false). network-info.maximum-network-cards - The maximum number of network cards per instance. network-info.maximum-network-interfaces - The maximum number of network interfaces per instance. network-info.network-performance - The network performance (for example, '25 Gigabit'). nitro-enclaves-support - Indicates whether Nitro Enclaves is supported ( supported | unsupported). nitro-tpm-support - Indicates whether NitroTPM is supported ( supported | unsupported). nitro-tpm-info.supported-versions - The supported NitroTPM version ( 2.0). processor-info.supported-architecture - The CPU architecture ( arm64 | i386 | x86_64). processor-info.sustained-clock-speed-in-ghz - The CPU clock speed, in GHz. processor-info.supported-features - The supported CPU features ( amd-sev-snp). supported-boot-mode - The boot mode ( legacy-bios | uefi). supported-root-device-type - The root device type ( ebs | instance-store). supported-usage-class - The usage class ( on-demand | spot | capacity-block). supported-virtualization-type - The virtualization type ( hvm | paravirtual). vcpu-info.default-cores - The default number of cores for the instance type. vcpu-info.default-threads-per-core - The default number of threads per core for the instance type. vcpu-info.default-vcpus - The default number of vCPUs for the instance type. vcpu-info.valid-cores - The number of cores that can be configured for the instance type. vcpu-info.valid-threads-per-core - The number of threads per core that can be configured for the instance type. For example, '1' or '1,2'. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

nested_items.name: InstanceTypes
nested_items.description: The instance type.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type. For more information, see Instance types in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: CurrentGeneration
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the instance type is current generation.

nested_items.name: FreeTierEligible
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the instance type is eligible for the free tier.

nested_items.name: SupportedUsageClasses
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the instance type is offered for spot, On-Demand, or Capacity Blocks.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportedRootDeviceTypes
nested_items.description: The supported root device types.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportedVirtualizationTypes
nested_items.description: The supported virtualization types.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: BareMetal
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the instance is a bare metal instance type.

nested_items.name: Hypervisor
nested_items.description: The hypervisor for the instance type.

nested_items.name: ProcessorInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the processor.

nested_items.name: SupportedArchitectures
nested_items.description: The architectures supported by the instance type.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SustainedClockSpeedInGhz
nested_items.description: The speed of the processor, in GHz.

nested_items.name: SupportedFeatures
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the instance type supports AMD SEV-SNP. If the request returns amd-sev-snp, AMD SEV-SNP is supported. Otherwise, it is not supported. For more information, see AMD SEV-SNP.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Manufacturer
nested_items.description: The manufacturer of the processor.

nested_items.name: DefaultVCpus
nested_items.description: The default number of vCPUs for the instance type.

nested_items.name: DefaultCores
nested_items.description: The default number of cores for the instance type.

nested_items.name: DefaultThreadsPerCore
nested_items.description: The default number of threads per core for the instance type.

nested_items.name: ValidCores
nested_items.description: The valid number of cores that can be configured for the instance type.
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: ValidThreadsPerCore
nested_items.description: The valid number of threads per core that can be configured for the instance type.
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: MemoryInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the memory for the instance type.

nested_items.name: SizeInMiB
nested_items.description: The size of the memory, in MiB.

nested_items.name: InstanceStorageSupported
nested_items.description: Indicates whether instance storage is supported.

nested_items.name: InstanceStorageInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the instance storage for the instance type.

nested_items.name: TotalSizeInGB
nested_items.description: The total size of the disks, in GB.

nested_items.name: Disks
nested_items.description: Describes the disks that are available for the instance type.

nested_items.name: SizeInGB
nested_items.description: The size of the disk in GB.

nested_items.name: Count
nested_items.description: The number of disks with this configuration.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of disk.

nested_items.name: NvmeSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether non-volatile memory express (NVMe) is supported.

nested_items.name: EncryptionSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether data is encrypted at rest.

nested_items.name: EbsOptimizedSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the instance type is Amazon EBS-optimized. For more information, see Amazon EBS-optimized instances in Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: EncryptionSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Amazon EBS encryption is supported.

nested_items.name: EbsOptimizedInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the optimized EBS performance for the instance type.

nested_items.name: BaselineBandwidthInMbps
nested_items.description: The baseline bandwidth performance for an EBS-optimized instance type, in Mbps.

nested_items.name: BaselineThroughputInMBps
nested_items.description: The baseline throughput performance for an EBS-optimized instance type, in MB/s.

nested_items.name: BaselineIops
nested_items.description: The baseline input/output storage operations per seconds for an EBS-optimized instance type.

nested_items.name: MaximumBandwidthInMbps
nested_items.description: The maximum bandwidth performance for an EBS-optimized instance type, in Mbps.

nested_items.name: MaximumThroughputInMBps
nested_items.description: The maximum throughput performance for an EBS-optimized instance type, in MB/s.

nested_items.name: MaximumIops
nested_items.description: The maximum input/output storage operations per second for an EBS-optimized instance type.

nested_items.name: NvmeSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether non-volatile memory express (NVMe) is supported.

nested_items.name: NetworkInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the network settings for the instance type.

nested_items.name: NetworkPerformance
nested_items.description: The network performance.

nested_items.name: MaximumNetworkInterfaces
nested_items.description: The maximum number of network interfaces for the instance type.

nested_items.name: MaximumNetworkCards
nested_items.description: The maximum number of physical network cards that can be allocated to the instance.

nested_items.name: DefaultNetworkCardIndex
nested_items.description: The index of the default network card, starting at 0.

nested_items.name: NetworkCards
nested_items.description: Describes the network cards for the instance type.

nested_items.name: NetworkCardIndex
nested_items.description: The index of the network card.

nested_items.name: NetworkPerformance
nested_items.description: The network performance of the network card.

nested_items.name: MaximumNetworkInterfaces
nested_items.description: The maximum number of network interfaces for the network card.

nested_items.name: BaselineBandwidthInGbps
nested_items.description: The baseline network performance of the network card, in Gbps.

nested_items.name: PeakBandwidthInGbps
nested_items.description: The peak (burst) network performance of the network card, in Gbps.

nested_items.name: Ipv4AddressesPerInterface
nested_items.description: The maximum number of IPv4 addresses per network interface.

nested_items.name: Ipv6AddressesPerInterface
nested_items.description: The maximum number of IPv6 addresses per network interface.

nested_items.name: Ipv6Supported
nested_items.description: Indicates whether IPv6 is supported.

nested_items.name: EnaSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Elastic Network Adapter (ENA) is supported.

nested_items.name: EfaSupported
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Elastic Fabric Adapter (EFA) is supported.

nested_items.name: MaximumEfaInterfaces
nested_items.description: The maximum number of Elastic Fabric Adapters for the instance type.

nested_items.name: EncryptionInTransitSupported
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the instance type automatically encrypts in-transit traffic between instances.

nested_items.name: EnaSrdSupported
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the instance type supports ENA Express. ENA Express uses Amazon Web Services Scalable Reliable Datagram (SRD) technology to increase the maximum bandwidth used per stream and minimize tail latency of network traffic between EC2 instances.

nested_items.name: BandwidthWeightings
nested_items.description: A list of valid settings for configurable bandwidth weighting for the instance type, if supported.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Gpus
nested_items.description: Describes the GPU accelerators for the instance type.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the GPU accelerator.

nested_items.name: Manufacturer
nested_items.description: The manufacturer of the GPU accelerator.

nested_items.name: Count
nested_items.description: The number of GPUs for the instance type.

nested_items.name: MemoryInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the memory available to the GPU accelerator.

nested_items.name: SizeInMiB
nested_items.description: The size of the memory available to the GPU accelerator, in MiB.

nested_items.name: TotalGpuMemoryInMiB
nested_items.description: The total size of the memory for the GPU accelerators for the instance type, in MiB.

nested_items.name: Fpgas
nested_items.description: Describes the FPGAs for the instance type.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the FPGA accelerator.

nested_items.name: Manufacturer
nested_items.description: The manufacturer of the FPGA accelerator.

nested_items.name: Count
nested_items.description: The count of FPGA accelerators for the instance type.

nested_items.name: MemoryInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the memory for the FPGA accelerator for the instance type.

nested_items.name: SizeInMiB
nested_items.description: The size of the memory available to the FPGA accelerator, in MiB.

nested_items.name: TotalFpgaMemoryInMiB
nested_items.description: The total memory of all FPGA accelerators for the instance type.

nested_items.name: PlacementGroupInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the placement group settings for the instance type.

nested_items.name: SupportedStrategies
nested_items.description: The supported placement group types.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InferenceAcceleratorInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the Inference accelerator settings for the instance type.

nested_items.name: Accelerators
nested_items.description: Describes the Inference accelerators for the instance type.

nested_items.name: Count
nested_items.description: The number of Inference accelerators for the instance type.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the Inference accelerator.

nested_items.name: Manufacturer
nested_items.description: The manufacturer of the Inference accelerator.

nested_items.name: MemoryInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the memory available to the inference accelerator.

nested_items.name: SizeInMiB
nested_items.description: The size of the memory available to the inference accelerator, in MiB.

nested_items.name: TotalInferenceMemoryInMiB
nested_items.description: The total size of the memory for the inference accelerators for the instance type, in MiB.

nested_items.name: HibernationSupported
nested_items.description: Indicates whether On-Demand hibernation is supported.

nested_items.name: BurstablePerformanceSupported
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the instance type is a burstable performance T instance type. For more information, see Burstable performance instances.

nested_items.name: DedicatedHostsSupported
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Dedicated Hosts are supported on the instance type.

nested_items.name: AutoRecoverySupported
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Amazon CloudWatch action based recovery is supported.

nested_items.name: SupportedBootModes
nested_items.description: The supported boot modes. For more information, see Boot modes in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: NitroEnclavesSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Nitro Enclaves is supported.

nested_items.name: NitroTpmSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether NitroTPM is supported.

nested_items.name: NitroTpmInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the supported NitroTPM versions for the instance type.

nested_items.name: SupportedVersions
nested_items.description: Indicates the supported NitroTPM versions.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MediaAcceleratorInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the media accelerator settings for the instance type.

nested_items.name: Accelerators
nested_items.description: Describes the media accelerators for the instance type.

nested_items.name: Count
nested_items.description: The number of media accelerators for the instance type.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the media accelerator.

nested_items.name: Manufacturer
nested_items.description: The manufacturer of the media accelerator.

nested_items.name: MemoryInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the memory available to the media accelerator.

nested_items.name: SizeInMiB
nested_items.description: The size of the memory available to each media accelerator, in MiB.

nested_items.name: TotalMediaMemoryInMiB
nested_items.description: The total size of the memory for the media accelerators for the instance type, in MiB.

nested_items.name: NeuronInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the Neuron accelerator settings for the instance type.

nested_items.name: NeuronDevices
nested_items.description: Describes the neuron accelerators for the instance type.

nested_items.name: Count
nested_items.description: The number of neuron accelerators for the instance type.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the neuron accelerator.

nested_items.name: Count
nested_items.description: The number of cores available to the neuron accelerator.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The version of the neuron accelerator.

nested_items.name: MemoryInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the memory available to each neuron accelerator.

nested_items.name: SizeInMiB
nested_items.description: The size of the memory available to the neuron accelerator, in MiB.

nested_items.name: TotalNeuronDeviceMemoryInMiB
nested_items.description: The total size of the memory for the neuron accelerators for the instance type, in MiB.

nested_items.name: PhcSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a local Precision Time Protocol (PTP) hardware clock (PHC) is supported.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to include in another request to get the next page of items. This value is null when there are no more items to return.
